Directories Basic.ls -a: List current dir contents including hidden
Directories Basic.ls -t: List current dir contents sorted by mod date

Files Basic.mv file1 file2: Rename or move file1 to file2

Search Basic.cmd | grep pattern: Search for 'pattern' in output of cmd

Shortcuts.ctrl+d: Delete char infront of cursor or logout

Processes.fg: Bring most recent job to foreground

Text Editing Beginner.ctrl+L: Select line - Repeat to select next lines
Text Editing Beginner.ctrl+D: Select word - repeat select other occurrences
Text Editing Beginner.shift+ctrl+M: Select all contents of the current parentheses

Text Editing Intermediate.ctrl+Kctrl+K: Delete from cursor to end of line
Text Editing Intermediate.ctrl+Kctrl+BACKSPACE: Delete from cursor to start of line
Text Editing Intermediate.ctrl+J: Join line below to the end of the current line
Text Editing Intermediate.ctrl+Y: Redo or repeat last keyboard shortcut command

Text Selection.alt+ctrl+DOWN: Add new line below with cursor
Text Selection.alt+F3: Add cursor at all occurrences of a word
Text Selection.alt+ctrl+UP: Add new line above with cursor

Multi-cursor / Selection I.shift+ctrl+L: Select all occurrences of current selection
Multi-cursor / Selection I.shift+alt+I: Insert cursor at end of each line selected

Search / Replace I.ctrl+Kctrl+D: Move last selection to next Find match
Search / Replace I.alt+\u21b5: Select all occurrences of Find match
Search / Replace I.ctrl+D: Add selection to next Find match

Navigation I.shift+F8: Go to previous error or warning
Navigation I.F8: Go to next error or warning

Editing I.ctrl+/: Comment/uncomment current line or selected block with line comments
Editing I.ctrl+I: Implement base interface/class methods in the current class
Editing I.ctrl+O: Override base class methods in the current class
Editing I.ctrl+P: Show parameters of the method call at caret
Editing I.alt+ctrl+T: Surround selected code fragment with if, while, try/catch or other construct

Editing II.alt+ctrl+I: Indent current line or selected block according to the code style settings
Editing II.shift+alt+ctrl+V: Paste without formatting, autoimport, literal escaping etc.

Running / Debugging.alt+F9: Run to the line where the caret is
Running / Debugging.F7: Step to the next line executed
Running / Debugging.shift+F8: Step to the first line executed after returning from this method
Running / Debugging.F8: Step to the next line in this file
Running / Debugging.shift+ctrl+F8: View and manage all breakpoints and watchpoints

Navigation I.ctrl+B: Navigate to the declaration of the symbol at caret
Navigation I.F4: Open editor for the selected item and give focus to it
Navigation I.ctrl+E: Show list of recently viewed files
Navigation I.shift+ctrl+E: Show list of recently changed files
Navigation I.alt+ctrl+HOME: Navigate to one of the related or linked files
Navigation I.shift+alt+RIGHT: Select Next Tab in multi-editor file
Navigation I.shift+alt+LEFT: Select Previous Tab in multi-editor file

Navigation II.alt+ctrl+H: Browse call hierarchy for the selected method
Navigation II.alt+ctrl+B: Navigate to the implementation of class or method
Navigation II.shift+ctrl+BACKSPACE: Move through the most recent change points
Navigation II.shift+ctrl+H: Browse method hierarchy for the selected method
Navigation II.F2: Navigate to the next highlighted error in the active editor
Navigation II.shift+F2: Navigate to the previous highlighted error in the active editor
Navigation II.ctrl+U: Navigate to the declaration of the method that current method overrides or implements
Navigation II.ctrl+H: Browse hierarchy for the selected class

Navigation III.ctrl+]: Move Caret to Code Block End
Navigation III.shift+ctrl+]: Move Caret to Code Block End with Selection
Navigation III.ctrl+[: Move Caret to Code Block Start
Navigation III.shift+ctrl+[: Move Caret to Code Block Start with Selection
Navigation III.shift+END: Move Caret to Line End with Selection
Navigation III.shift+HOME: Move Caret to Line Start with Selection
Navigation III.shift+ctrl+RIGHT: Move Caret to Next Word with Selection
Navigation III.shift+alt+DOWN: Move selected lines one line down
Navigation III.shift+alt+UP: Move selected lines one line up

Refactoring.shift+F5: Create a copy of the selected class, file or directory in the same package/directory
Refactoring.alt+ctrl+C: Replace selected expression with a constant
Refactoring.shift+alt+ctrl+C: Copy reference to selected class, method or function
Refactoring.F5: Create a copy of the selected class
Refactoring.alt+ctrl+N: Inline the selected method or variable
Refactoring.alt+ctrl+M: Turn the selected code fragment into a method
Refactoring.F6: Move the selected class, method, package or static member to another package or class and correct all references
Refactoring.alt+ctrl+P: Turn the selected expression into method parameter
Refactoring.shift+F6: Rename the selected symbol and correct all references
Refactoring.alt+DEL: Delete the selected class, method or field, checking for usages
Refactoring.alt+ctrl+J: Surrounds the selection with one of the template
Refactoring.alt+ctrl+V: Put a result of the selected expression into a variable

Git Basics.git diff: Show what's changed but not yet staged
Git Basics.git fetch develop: Pull data from remote 'develop' without merging
Git Basics.git pull origin develop: Fetch and merge branch 'develop' from origin
Git Basics.git clone url: Create local copy of remote repository at 'url'

Branching.git push origin master: Push master branch to origin server
Branching.git branch -v: Show last commit on all branches
Branching.git checkout -b feature2: Create branch 'feature2' and switch to it
Branching.git branch --merged: Show branches already merged into current branch
Branching.git branch --no-merged: Show branches not yet merged into current branch
Branching.git branch -D fix: Force delete branch 'fix' that is not yet merged
Branching.git push staging develop:master: Push develop branch to remote staging master
Branching.git checkout -b fix1 origin/fix1: Create local branch 'fix1' based off origin branch
Branching.git checkout --track origin/fix2: Create tracking branch 'fix2' based off origin

Merging / Rebasing.git add file.txt: Mark file.txt as resolved after merge
Merging / Rebasing.git rebase develop: Rebase changes made on current branch over develop
Merging / Rebasing.git rebase master develop: Rebase master onto develop without checking it out
Merging / Rebasing.git rebase --onto master 1a 1b: Rebase master onto branch 1b made from branch 1a

Remotes.git remote: Show remote servers you have configured
Remotes.git remote -v: Show remote servers with URL displayed

Commit Logs.git log -p -2: Show last two commits with diffs
Commit Logs.git log --pretty=oneline: Show commit logs one per line
Commit Logs.git log --graph: Show commit logs with ascii graph
Commit Logs.git log --since=1.week: Show commit log for the last week
Commit Logs.git blame -L 10,15 file.rb: Show prev commits for each lines 10-15 of file.rb

Undo / Change History.git rm --cached main.txt: Remove main.txt from staging but keep in working
Undo / Change History.git rebase -i HEAD~3: Make changes to the last 3 commits

Using Tags.git push origin --tags: Push all local tags to origin

Using Stashes.git stash apply --index: Reapply stashed changes along with staged changes
Using Stashes.git stash pop: Apply most recent stash and drop from stack
Using Stashes.git diff --staged: Show what's staged but not yet committed
Using Stashes.git diff --check: Check for whitespace errors before committing

Using Bisect.git bisect start: Start binary search of commits to find bad commit
Using Bisect.git bisect bad: Mark current commit as broken during bisect
Using Bisect.git bisect good v2.2: Mark v2.2 as last known good commit during bisect
Using Bisect.git bisect good: Mark current commit as good during bisect
Using Bisect.git bisect reset: Reset HEAD when finished with bisect
Using Bisect.git bisect run test.sh: Run 'test.sh' on each commit during bisect

Prompt I.tmux new -s name: Start new session with name 'name' from prompt

Misc I.tmux a -t name: Attach session to named 'name' from prompt

Characters I.^: Match the start of the string
Characters I.$: Match the end of the string

Special Sequences I.\\A: Match only at start of string
Special Sequences I.\\b: Match empty string, only at beginning or end of a word
Special Sequences I.\\B: Match empty string, only when it is not at beginning or end of word
Special Sequences I.\\D: Match any non digit # same as [^0-9]

Characters II.[lower-upper]: Match a set of characters from lower to upper
Characters II.[^]: Match characters NOT in a set
Characters II.A|B: Match either A or B regular expressions (non-greedy)

Special Sequences II.\\w: Match unicode word characters # same as [a-zA-Z0-9_]
Special Sequences II.\\W: Match any character not a Unicode word character # same as [^a-zA-Z0-9_]
Special Sequences II.\\Z: Match only at end of string

Characters III.{m,n}: Match from m to n repetitions
Characters III.{m,}: Match from m to infinite repetitions
Characters III.{m,n}?: Match from m to n repetitions non-greedy (as few as possible)

RE Methods I.re.compile(pattern, flags): Compile a regular expression of pattern, with flags
RE Methods I.re.match(pattern, string): Match pattern only at beginning of string
RE Methods I.re.search(pattern, string): Match pattern anywhere in the string
RE Methods I.re.split(pattern, string): Split string by occurrences of patern
RE Methods I.re.sub(pattern, str2, string): Replace leftmost non-overlapping occurrences of pattern in string with str2

Groups I.(match): Use to specify a group for which match can be retrieved later
Groups I.(?:match): Non-capturing version parenthesis (match cannot be retrieved later)
Groups I.(?P=name): Back reference group named "name" in same pattern

Match Objects I.match.groups(): Return tuple containing all subgroups of match
Match Objects I.match.groupdict(): Return dict containing all named subgroups of match
Match Objects I.match.start(group): Return start index of substring match by group
Match Objects I.match.end(group): Return end index of substring matched by group
Match Objects I.match.span(group): Return 2-tuple start and end indices of group in match

Lookahead / Behind I.(?=match): Lookahead assertion - match if contents matches next, but don't consume any of the string.
Lookahead / Behind I.(?!match): Negative lookahead assertion - match if contents do not match next
Lookahead / Behind I.(?<=match): Positive lookbehind assertion - match if current position in string is preceded by match
Lookahead / Behind I.(?<!match): Negative lookbehind assertion - match if current position is not preceded by match
Lookahead / Behind I.(?(id/name)yes|no): Match "yes" pattern if id or name exists, otherwise match "no" pattern

Match Objects II.match.pos: Value of pos which was passed to search() or match()
Match Objects II.match.endpos: Value of endpos which was passed to search() or match()
Match Objects II.match.lastindex: Integer index of last matched capturing group
Match Objects II.match.lastgroup: Name of last matched capturing group
Match Objects II.match.re: The regular expression who match() or search() created this match
Match Objects II.match.string: The string passed to match() or search()

RE Methods II.re.fullmatch(pattern, string): Match pattern if whole string matches regular expression
RE Methods II.re.findall(pattern, string): Return all non-overlapping matches of pattern in string, as a list of strings
RE Methods II.re.finditer(pattern, string): Return an iterator yielding match objects over non-overlapping matches of pattern in string
RE Methods II.re.subn(pattern, str2, string): Replace left most occurrences of pattern in string with str2, but return a tuple of (newstring, # subs made)

Pasting I.Pp: Open URL from clipboard in new tab
Pasting I.PP: Open URL from selection in new tab
Pasting I.wp: Open URL from clipboard in new window
Pasting I.wP: Open URL from selection in new window

Navigation I.{{: Click "preious"-link on page in new tab
Navigation I.}}: Click "next"-link on page in new tab

Opening I.gO: Open based on cur. URL in new tab
Opening I.xO: Open based on cur. URL in background tab

Extended Hint Mode I.;o: Put hinted URL in cmd. line
Extended Hint Mode I.;O: Put hinted URL in cmd. line in new tab

Misc Commands I.gU: Navigate up in URL in new tab

Cases I.s.swapcase(): Swap cases of all characters in s # 'Hello' => "hELLO"

Sequence Operations I.s2 in s: Return true if s contains s2

Sequence Operations II.s2 not in s: Return true if s does not contain s2
Sequence Operations II.s * integer: Return integer copies of s concatenated # 'hello' => 'hellohellohello'
Sequence Operations II.s[i:j:k]: Slice of s from i to j with step k

Whitespace I.s.center(width): Center s with blank padding of width # 'hi' => ' hi '
Whitespace I.s.isspace(): Return true if s only contains whitespace characters
Whitespace I.s.ljust(width): Left justifiy s with total size of width # 'hello' => 'hello '
Whitespace I.s.rjust(width): Right justify s with total size of width # 'hello' => ' hello'
Whitespace I.s.strip(): Remove leading and trailing whitespace from s # ' hello ' => 'hello'

Find / Replace I.s.index(s2, i, j): Index of first occurrence of s2 in s after index i and before index j
Find / Replace I.s.find(s2): Find and return lowest index of s2 in s
Find / Replace I.s.index(s2): Return lowest index of s2 in s (but raise ValueError if not found)
Find / Replace I.s.replace(s2, s3): Replace s2 with s3 in s
Find / Replace I.s.replace(s2, s3, count): Replace s2 with s3 in s at most count times
Find / Replace I.s.rfind(s2): Return highest index of s2 in s
Find / Replace I.s.rindex(s2): Return highest index of s2 in s (raise ValueError if not found)

Cases II.s.casefold(): Casefold s (aggressive lowercasing for caseless matching) # 'ßorat' => 'ssorat'
Cases II.s.islower(): Return true if s is lowercase
Cases II.s.istitle(): Return true if s is titlecased # 'Hello World' => true
Cases II.s.isupper(): Return true if s is uppercase

Inspection I.s.endswith(s2): Return true if s ends with s2
Inspection I.s.isalnum(): Return true if s is alphanumeric
Inspection I.s.isalpha(): Return true if s is alphabetic
Inspection I.s.isdecimal(): Return true if s is decimal
Inspection I.s.isnumeric(): Return true if s is numeric
Inspection I.s.startswith(s2): Return true is s starts with s2

Splitting I.s.partition(sep): Partition string at sep and return 3-tuple with part before, the sep itself, and part after # 'hello' => ('he', 'l', 'lo')
Splitting I.s.rpartition(sep): Partition string at last occurrence of sep, return 3-tuple with part before, the sep, and part after # 'hello' => ('hel', 'l', 'o')
Splitting I.s.rsplit(sep, maxsplit): Return list of s split by sep with rightmost maxsplits performed
Splitting I.s.split(sep, maxsplit): Return list of s split by sep with leftmost maxsplits performed
Splitting I.s.splitlines(): Return a list of lines in s # 'hello\nworld' => ['hello', 'world']

Inspection II.s[i:j]: Slice of s from i to j
Inspection II.s.endswith((s1, s2, s3)): Return true if s ends with any of string tuple s1, s2, and s3
Inspection II.s.isdigit(): Return true if s is digit
Inspection II.s.isidentifier(): Return true if s is a valid identifier
Inspection II.s.isprintable(): Return true is s is printable

Whitespace II.s.center(width, pad): Center s with padding pad of width # 'hi' => 'padpadhipadpad'
Whitespace II.s.expandtabs(integer): Replace all tabs with spaces of tabsize integer # 'hello\tworld' => 'hello world'
Whitespace II.s.lstrip(): Remove leading whitespace from s # ' hello ' => 'hello '
Whitespace II.s.rstrip(): Remove trailing whitespace from s # ' hello ' => ' hello'
Whitespace II.s.zfill(width): Left fill s with ASCII '0' digits with total length width # '42' => '00042'

Basics I.str[n]: Return nth character of string str
Basics I.str.charAt(index): Return character in string str at specified index
Basics I.str.toLowerCase(): Convert string str to lower case
Basics I.str.toUpperCase(): Convert string str to upper case

General I.str.indexOf(substr): Return first index within string str of substring substr
General I.str.split(separator): Split string str into an array of substrings separated by param separator
General I.str.trim(): Trim whitespace from beginning and end of string str
General I.str1 < str2: Return true if str1 is less than str2
General I.str1 > str2: return true if str1 is greater than str2

Experimental I.str.codePointAt(index): Return non-negative int from string str that is the UTF-16 encoded code point at given index
Experimental I.str1.includes(str2): Return true if str2 is found in string str1
Experimental I.str1.endsWith(str2): Return true if string str1 ends with string str2
Experimental I.str.normalize(): Return Unicode Normalization Form of string str
Experimental I.str.repeat(int): Return string repeated int times of string str
Experimental I.str1.startsWith(str2): Return true if string str1 starts with str2
Experimental I.str[@@iterator](): Return a new Iterator that iterates over the code points of string str, returning each code point as String value

General II.str.charCodeAt(index): Return number indicating Unicode value of char at given index of string str
General II.str1.concat(str2): Combine text of strings str1 and str2 and return a new string
General II.str.lastIndexOf(substr): Return last index within string str of substring substr
General II.str.slice(start, end): Extract a section of string str from start to end
General II.str.substr(start, length): Return characters in string str from start having length length

General III.str.substring(index1, index2): Return subset of string str between index1 and index2
General III.str.toLocaleLowerCase(): Convert chars in string str to lower case while respecting current locale
General III.str.toLocaleUpperCase(): Convert chars in string str to upper case while respecting current locale
General III.str.trimLeft(): Trim whitespace from left side of string st
General III.str.trimRight(): Trim whitespace form right side of string str

General IV.str1.localeCompare(str2): Return -1, 0, or 1 indicating if string str1 is less than, equal to, or greater than str2
General IV.str.match(regexp): Match a regular expression regexp against string str
General IV.str1.replace(regexp, str2): Replace matched regexp elements in string str1 with string str2
General IV.str.search(regexp): Return position of search for a match between regexp and string str

Accessing Elements I.a1.concat(a2): Return new array by joining arrays a1 and a2 together
Accessing Elements I.a1.join(separator): Join all elements of array a1 into a string separated by separator arg
Accessing Elements I.a1.slice(start, end): Extract a section from start to end of array a1 and return a new array
Accessing Elements I.a1.indexOf(obj): Return first index of obj within array a1
Accessing Elements I.a1.lastIndexOf(obj): Return last index of obj within array a1

Iterating I.a1.forEach(fn): Calls function fn for each element in the array a1
Iterating I.a1.every(fn): Return true if every element in array a1 satisfies provided testing function fn
Iterating I.a1.some(fn): Return true if at least one element in array a1 satisfies provided testing function fn
Iterating I.a1.filter(fn): Create a new array with all elements of array a1 which pass the filtering function fn

Iterating II.a1.map(fn): Create a new array with results of calling function fn on every element in array a1
Iterating II.a1.reduce(fn): Apply a function fn against an accumulator and each value (from left to right) of the array as to reduce it to a single value
Iterating II.a1.reduceRight(fn): Apply a function fn against an accumulator and each value (from right to left) of the array as to reduce it to a single value

Mutating I.a1.pop(): Remove and return last element from array a1
Mutating I.a1.push(obj): Add obj to end of array a1 and return new length
Mutating I.a1.reverse(): Reverse order of elements of array a1 in place
Mutating I.a1.sort(): Sort the elements of array a1 in place
Mutating I.a1.splice(start, deleteCount, items): Change content of array a1 by removing existing elements and/or adding new elements
Mutating I.a1.unshift(obj): Add obj to start of array a1 and return new length

General I.a1.toString(): Return a string representing array a1 and its elements (same as a1. join(','))
General I.a1.toLocaleString(): Return a localized string representing array a1 and its elements (similar to a1.join(','))
General I.Array.isArray(var): Return true if var is an array
General I.a1[0]: Access first element of array a1

Basics.*: Match preceding character 0 or more times
Basics.+: Match preceding character 1 or more times

Character Classes I.\\s: Match a single white space character (space, tab, form feed, or line feed)
Character Classes I.\\S: Match a single character other than white space

Character Classes II.[abc]: Match any one of the characters in the set 'abc'
Character Classes II.[^abc]: Match anything not in character set 'abc'

Quantifiers.{n}: Match exactly n occurrences of preceding character
Quantifiers.{n,m}: Match at least n and at most m occurrences of the preceding character

Special Characters I.\\cX: Match control character X in a string

Special Characters II.\\xhh: Match character with code hh (2 hex digits)
Special Characters II.\\uhhhh: Match character with code hhhh (4 hex digits)

Flags.y: "sticky" search match starting at current position in target string

Groups.(?:x): Match 'x' but do not remember the match
Groups.\\n: A back reference to the last substring matching the n parenthetical in the regex

Tool Cycling II.shift+U: Cycle rect, ellipse, poly, line, shape
Tool Cycling II.shift+K: Cycle 2d object, roll, pan, slide, scale
Tool Cycling II.shift+N: Cycle 3d camera rotate, roll, pan, walk, zoom

View.Q: Toggle standard and quick mask mode

Code Navigation I.cmd+LEFT: Move to First Character of Line
Code Navigation I.cmd+RIGHT: Move to Last Character of Line

Code Selection II.shift+cmd+LEFT: Select to First Character of Line
Code Selection II.shift+cmd+RIGHT: Select to Last Character of Line
Code Selection II.shift+DOWN: Select to Same Position, Next Line
Code Selection II.shift+UP: Select to Same Position, Previous Line

Find & Replace.shift+cmd+F: Find String in All Project Files

Text Editing Beginner.cmd+L: Select line - repeat to select next lines
Text Editing Beginner.cmd+D: Select word - repeat select others occurrences
Text Editing Beginner.shift+ctrl+M: Select all contents of the current parentheses

Text Editing Intermediate.cmd+Y: Redo or repeat last keyboard shortcut command

Text Editing Intermediate II.cmd+Kcmd+K: Delete from cursor to end of line
Text Editing Intermediate II.cmd+KBACKSPACE: Delete from cursor to start of line

All Panels.ESC: Toggle Console / close settings dialog when open
All Panels.shift+cmd+R: Refresh the page ignoring cached content
All Panels.cmd+F: Text search within current file or panel

Sources Panel.shift+cmd+C: Open / switch from inspect element mode and browser window

Tool Cycling.shift+U: Cycle rect, ellipse, poly, line, shapes
Tool Cycling.shift+K: Cycle 3d object, roll, pan, slide, scale
Tool Cycling.shift+N: Cycle 3d camera rotate, roll, pan, walk

Multi-cursor / Selection I.shift+alt+I: Insert cursor at end of each line selected
Multi-cursor / Selection I.shift+cmd+L: Select all occurrences of current selection
Multi-cursor / Selection I.cmd+F2: Select all occurrences of current word

Search / Replace I.cmd+D: Add selection to next Find match
Search / Replace I.alt+\u21b5: Select all occurrences of Find match
Search / Replace I.cmd+Kcmd+D: Move last selection to next Find match

Navigation I.F8: Go to next error or warning
Navigation I.shift+F8: Go to previous error or warning

Editing I.alt+DOWN: Decrease current selection to previous state

Editing II.cmd+D: Duplicate current line or selected block

Editing III.shift+cmd+U: Toggle case for word at caret or selected block

General.shift+alt+I: Inspect current file with current profile

Navigation III.shift+ESC: Hide active or last active window
Navigation III.alt+F1: Select current file or symbol in any view
